sentence.idiomatic: He is fascinated by photography exhibitions recently.
I am not fascinated by professional photography.
Are you fascinated by photography?
He always takes a digital camera with him.
She never takes a lot of film with her.
Does your father always carry a lot of lenses with him?
I am seriously learning photography.
He is not really studying at all.
Can you be serious when you're taking a photo?

word.literal: details one needs be particular about

sentence.idiomatic: Photography has many particulars.
He doesn’t pay attention to composition at all when he's taking photos.

word.literal: to be or not to be

sentence.idiomatic: Is lighting also as particular and complicated?
He makes photography very interesting in one or two words.
How to use lighting can’t be explained clearly in one or two words.
How can I put it clearly in one or two words?
The choice of lenses can reflect on whether a person is a professional photographer or not.
Side light cannot reflect her beauty.
What does this photo reflect on?
I've been fascinated by photography recently. I always carry a camera around with me.
Really? Photography encompass a huge body of knowledge. Are you doing it for fun or for real?
It was out of interest at first. But I am studying it seriously now. The more I learn it, the more I find it interesting.
Are there any important rules in photography? Or is instinct primary?
Instinct is important for sure. But you must learn some basic skills and techniques really well.
What are they?

The most principal ones are composition, lighting and equipment. Let's start with composition. To put it simply, it's about making selective shots through the viewfinder. Direction, angle, and distance are the key factors. The most commonly used method of the 'golden ratio' uses a formula to calculate proportion and make the final composition.
I see. What about lighting? Is it also as complicated?

Absolutely. Photography is painting with light and objects. There are generally three types of light: front light, back light and side light. In addition, there are soft and hard light in terms of quality of light.
You sound really professional with all your extensive knowledge. Is professional photography limited to using film? Can't you use a digital camera?
It's not that you can't. But I find using film can really bring out the joy of photography. But now, a lot of digital cameras are very well-made. Take focal length for example - it's very precise.
I've also heard that lenses are a big cost. What makes a good quality lens?

word.literal: to be unable to speak clearly

sentence.idiomatic: Actually there are many types of lenses for different uses. They are a very sophisticated work of art, like photography itself. You can't really get the full picture in just a few words. I can tell you in more details if you are interested.
